nevermind I found it. I needed to download an audio codec (ac3filter or something)

to seed just means to continue uploading once you have the entire torrent, and yes, it's a very good thing to do ;)  it's the only way for a torrent to survive.  if no one else did it, you wouldn't have been able to download it in the first place.  

in order to seed, just make sure the torrent continues to run after you have 100% of it.  you can either force it to run until you decide to stop it, or set it to run for an amount of time or download/upload ratio.  definitely make sure you give what you take at the very minimum which would mean a ratio of 1

That being said, I have this full series already. I was hoping the quality of this .torrent was better than my version...not so much. The only difference I noticed was in Season 5. It appears that each episode in this season is doubled the size of what I have without increasing the quality of the file. The resolution is the same, the length of time is the same, and they are both full screen.

All that being said, thank you uploader for seeding this.

The Wire was made in standard definition and in less than perfect quality intentionally.  It's supposed to look gritty and wore out, something that will become more apparent on huge HD TVs.

As for the torrent, many, many thanks.  I've only seen The Wire the once and the box set is ĂÂŁ60, something I can't justify paying with mouths to feed.  A superb torrent which I (and hopefully others) will seed.

So I've got to ask, what's the deal with the speeds I'm getting on this torrent? I'm connected to a good number of seeds and peers, I've got no limits on download or upload speeds, but somehow I'm still getting incredibly low speeds (much lower than for anything else I download from here). What gives?

First off, not DVD quality. I know the show is supposed to look gritty but this is pretty much the same as the other torrents laying around. Saying this is DVD quality is VERY misleading. 
Second, to all those asking about their download speed, listen up. Just because your torrent says it is going to take six months or a year doesn't mean anything. Let it sit for 2-4 weeks and if it isn't at least halfway done, then perhaps consider asking if someone could be kind enough to seed. 
Thirdly, remember, this is not todays episode of Big Bang Theory or Glee or whatnot. It will not download in the same manner. Helping to seed, even after you have finished downloading, is key to everyone being able to have what they want.

@arigold, figure it out, man, shit. You click the magnet, it opens in your torrent program. A couple of minutes and it gives you a list of files. Select the ones you don't want, right click, choose "priority" in bt or ut, select do not download. Or just select the ones and click the Stop button. Don't bitch about things if you don't know basic steps.
